review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These bibs and jacket are the ones I've been looking for. Durable, dry and comfortable.
review.name: Better Get You Some!

review.reviewBody: well made with room in the things and hips. I‚Äôm able to climb up the ladder to the roof of my boat without them binding
review.name: sturdy fabric

review.reviewBody: The bibs were oversold and I never got mine. Very upsetting as I was looking forward to having the whole suit but just have the jacket. The jacket is very nice but the gambler bibs to go with it seem very light weight.
review.name: No bibs

review.reviewBody:
Grundens makes great products and the quality of this product is fantastic just like the other Grundens products I own. Although the quality of this product is great it's design lacks, which is why I can only give it three stars.

The biggest issue that I have with this bib is the zipper placement. It does not go all the way down to the crotch and this makes it very difficult when you need to relieve yourself. I end up having to take the shoulder straps off each time which to me defeats the purpose of having the zipper in the first place. If the zipper went all the ways down to the crotch without it being blocked with that extra material this problem would not exist. Additionally, there is only one pocket and for the price I expected there to be multiple.
review.name: Great Quality.  Poor Design

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality, fit and function of these bibs which I use daily for guide fishing use.
review.name: Tough guide üí™ use Bibs

review.reviewBody: Bought these for the simple reason that I needed a good pair of weather proof bibs for work. Every other bib I had gotten just ripped or rain eventually got in. Have had these for three years now and are still putting up with my abuse. The only reason I wouldn‚Äôt buy them again is because I‚Äôm 6‚Äô5‚Äù and they don‚Äôt really fit me. Tried to extend the straps, no luck. I finally just took them to a seamstress and had them extended. Problem solved. But wish every clothing company out there really would consider us tall humans. And I‚Äôm on the short side.
review.name: Great just not for tall people

review.reviewBody: Great product, fantastic fit. These bibs keep me dry and don‚Äôt ride up the leg when I sit, like competing brands do.
review.name: Montana Use

review.reviewBody: As I enter my third year of being an AB deckhand working tug and barge hauling freight in western Alaska 7 months of the year my duties require me to perform in extreme weather conditions performing extreme tasks. I recently made the mistake of putting the bins on while wearing my work boots and the entire inside from the waste down of the bibs blew out making them virtually impossible to wear and definitely very difficult to currently put on. They lasted me one entire season (7 months) and only one month into this current season. My heart is broken but I will still forever wear Grundens as they are unmatched. Now I only wish I had a second set.
review.name: Inside layer blow out.

review.reviewBody: If you‚Äôre reading this you probably already know gear failures while fishing is the #1 thing we all work to prevent. These bibs and Jacket will keep you warm, dry and are built to last. One less thing to worry about so you can focus on getting the bite.
review.name: Outstanding Performance & Quality

review.reviewBody: These are the best pair of bibs I‚Äôve ever owned. As a guide, a charterboat captain, and a deckhand I have put these bibs through some abuse every season and they still have their complete waterproof and I‚Äôm dry at the end of every trip. Plenty of storage space and clips for a belt. I have all of my tools I need on me at all times.
review.name: The best pair of bibs ever

name: Buoy X Gore-Tex 3L Bib - Men's

review.reviewBody: Wanted to love this shirt, was super stoked on it when it came out of the package.  A lot of merino shirts don't have a ton of stretch but this one does, and it felt great on.  However, after one wearing, the fit is just awful.  With this, stretch translates to stretch OUT.  For some reason the bottom stretched out horizontally to the point where it looked like I was wearing the liberty bell.  And while the length in the back is perfect, with the sideways stretching, it became basically a crop top in the front.  Cannot dream up a shirt less flattering than too short in the front with a bottom hem that flounces out like a poodle skirt.  Major disappointment because the fabric and color were both fabulous fresh outta the bag.  But honestly even at like 50% off I wouldn't buy this again.
review.name: So sad that it's such a disappointment
comment: Thank you for your feedback on this shirt and it's long term fit. I am so sorry that it didn't work out for you.  Reviews like this help other customers stay informed so thank you for your feedback! Since this product was a bust, please reach out to me if you'd like to process an exchange for something that will meet your needs better.

review.reviewBody: I had such high hopes for this shirt, but alas, it wasn't meant to be. The flare out at the bottom looks really silly if you are short.  The material seems very scratchy and I would have probably returned even if the fit was better.
review.name: Not for petite people

review.reviewBody: Light weight, quick drying. Full cut. Lon shirt tail.
review.name: Light weight

review.reviewBody: Overall, I would recommend this shirt. It is very lightweight and stands up to trail abuse. However, I sized into a small...but would recommend sizing up! The small fit very snug which leads to me constantly adjusting the shoulders and waist hem.
review.name: Light and breathable, but a bit small

review.reviewBody: Overall this is an excellent lightweight wool blend shirt with great stretch. I find it a bit clingy in the unflattering areas and feel a light itch when I first put it on, but it definitely got better and softer with washing. Overall I'd highly recommend it. Seems to do a great job at keeping odor at bay!
review.name: Great lightweight shirt - a bit clingy/itchy

review.reviewBody: I've worn this shirt several times, most days in a row, and it holds up nicely and doesn't retain odors!  It's held up to multiple washings and didn't shrink even after accidentally drying.   LOVE THIS SHIRT.  Lightweight and breathable.  I'm 5'3 and bought the small, fits perfectly and has a nice shape to it.
review.name: Cute and Functional wool shirt

review.reviewBody: I just received this tee this week.   It's perfect - the reviews below are accurate.  It is very lightweight, the fit is extremely flattering and comfortable, just the right amount of stretch, and is perfect on hot days for temperature regulating.  I'm going to be at a low angle certification course all next weekend outdoors in a PA swamp, and I plan on ordering two more to bring with me.  Very comfortable.  People are going to be sick of seeing me in it.
review.name: LOVE LOVE LOVE this tee

review.reviewBody: My initial reaction was disappointment that it wasn't very soft out of the package but I love it. So great for these crazy hot days, looks great, and really is comfortable even though it's not as soft as I was hoping for.
review.name: Initially concerned but I love it.

review.reviewBody: I love the fabric. This tee is light weight and breathable. The merino wool does a great job of regulating body temperature and the nylon gives it added strength. The fit is excellent.
review.name: My new favorite hiking tee!

review.reviewBody: This tee is so light and airy. Ive been biking in it and intend to have this as one of my go to tops for all things summer. Its breathable and manages sweat well- doesnt weigh down. After a couple wears, it stretches slightly but still looks good. My one complaint is that the fabric is delicate- it tears easily. It already has a noticeable spot where I caught the velcro of a pack. Maybe to be expected for how lightweight it is. Ill still buy another one or two but will be mindful, especially when climbing.
review.name: Simple, lightweight, perfect.

description: Buy the Eureka! Northern Breeze 10 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Northern Breeze 10
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Northern Breeze 10 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have, over the years, owned 3 Northern Breeze screen houses. Two NB12‚Äôs and one NB 10. There is nothing on the market that can compare. They will take whatever Mother Nature can dish out without a leak. Strong frames and quality construction is in a league of its own. Easy set up, with 4 foot flaps over screening give the NB12 a total of 20X20 feet of rain protection. Roof vents aid greatly in ventilation. I could go on much more, but you get the point. Bottom line: Yes it‚Äôs expensive BUT worth every penny. We just weathered Tropical Storm Debbie WITHOUT A SINGLE DROP ENTERING.
review.name: Camping Fortress

review.reviewBody: our northern breeze 10 just spent 2 weeks in the yard under wind, sun, a number of big rain downpours, and days above 85F others around 50 F . it never got wet inside, it was cosy comfortable in cold days but warmer than outside on hot days if all screens were zipped when it was full sun and 89F outdoors. it then was 91F to 93F inside the shelter. but with screendoors opened it was fine.
review.name: stands up to all weather conditions

review.reviewBody:
I really like this shelter as I needed something that I could easily put the sides down on and keep the water out.  

Pros:  
1) One person can set it up
2) Keeps the rain out and provides privacy if wanted
3) Overall well made

Cons:  
1) The poles for the side awnings are too tall.  If you actually set them up like that and it rained, the rain would run down into the shelter (I use bungees to attach to trees at the right level) I put a pole wedged in the picnic table with a cup on top to prop the entrances up higher so I don't have to duck as much
The opening is too short- I'm 5'7 and have to duck to get in
2) The screen should have a better roll up system so you can tie it above the entrance so it doesn't hang down and make the opening even lower.  As it is it also won't roll up and out of the way- sort of a spider web effect in the corner-same situation on the side panels- they roll up but hang down below the top of the shelter
3) Mine is dark blue- it looks like the color has since changed which is good as the blue can make it pretty hot inside

I wish I could get on an Eureka panel to review new products because when you camp for 2 weeks in a row, you get to know you're equipment pretty well.
review.name: Study and easy to set up
comment: Thank you for your thoughtful review! Here's a good tech tip regarding the awning in rain...move the bottom of the poles closer to the structure and re-tension the guy lines. This lowers the tips of the poles and the awning fabric will slope AWAY from the main structure. You may have to duck under the lower awning but...water will drain AWAY from the structure instead of towards it. Have fun out there!!!!

review.reviewBody: I have used the Northern Breeze 10 for one full summer and I am more then happy with it. Nothing like it one the market as it is so versatile. You can be completely sealed off from any rainstorm or breeze. I especially love that each wall can either fully or partially opened or closed. It makes for an ideal set up each time. I get a lot of compliments and questions when in use as it has a nice aesthetic design and can take on a variety of configurations.
review.name: Northern Breeze 10

review.reviewBody: It's now 2022 and still not ripped, all the zippers work. Even all the tie downs are still in one piece. Have the optional floor and the extra poles for all the sides up at once. It's a great investment..
review.name: My Northern Breeze is from the Class of 2010

review.reviewBody: Great tent. Came with a small hole in the mesh which we are not thrilled about after spending this kind of money. Relatively easy to install without it being a pop-up. It gets very hot inside when the awnings are down when it is hot outside. Easy to roll the awnings up.
review.name: Great Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We had our second child and needed to upgrade to a larger tent. This one fits the bill perfectly - it fits us and the 2 kids with enough room for everyone to sleep comfortably. Also love that the sides open to get a breeze on a warm night.
review.name: Perfect family tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We use this screenhouse in our backyard to add a shaded area for people to congregate. It is large enough for 7+ people and is easy to set-up. Once you attach the screenhouse sections to the poles and drive in the stakes, it is very sturdy, even in windy conditions. Doors and ventilation flaps can be opened on all 4 sides. I've used this brand of tent since I was young since our family did alot of alpine camping in the rocky mountains. They have good build quality and durability so I recommend this screenhouse.
review.name: Excellent Screenhouse

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just got this new Eureka screen house Northern Breeze 10 I love that it comes in a very sturdy and durable over-the-shoulder duffle big for easy packing and unpacking it's all nicely rolled into itself and and then then tied in a ball like a sleeping bag it doesn't weigh that much my oldest daughter can easily pick it up and carry it around it's under 30 lbs. Me and my grandkids put it up and used it on a nice sunny breezy day the polls are durable so they did not sway back and forth stayed very sturdy the awning was a nice thing to have up to get shade and the screened-in area was nice when I got a little darker in the book started coming out it started a Sprinkle also and I noticed it was very waterproof there wasn't any leakage. Assembly part of the screen house was pretty simple if you know a standard setup for a tent. all the polls already bound together with bungee and they pop into place almost by itself.
 otherwise there is built-in directions in the duffle bag the only con I would say would be that you definitely will need more than one person to set it up because it's so big it's not a one-man setup it's at least a two person setup process.
I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a new screen house this one definitely an amazing product he won't be let down.
review.name: Amazing screen house with multiple set up options

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you love camping but hate bugs, you'll love this screenhouse. It's the perfect addition to camping gear this summer. 
My favorite part of the screenhouse is that it's versatile and can be used in any campsite. 
It's easy to get a picnic table in there so that you can eat without bugs while still enjoying the outdoors. And the 6 foot walls make it so that even my tall husband can get in and out with ease.
I also love the UPF 50+ sun protection. My daughter and I have very fair skin and burn easily. It's great to have a place to go hang out when the sun is at the hottest point in the day. We sometimes sit in there and play board games.
All in all, I believe that this screenhouse is a must-have item if you go camping this summer. It even comes in a convenient carry case so it's easy to tote along!
review.name: If you love camping you'll love this!

name: Northern Breeze 10

review.reviewBody: Finally replaced my nearly 10 year old pair and I am incredibly disappointed to see the quality has fallen off of a cliff. These used to be some of the best gloves for cast iron cooking, but the new ones I received keep out so little heat they are basically useless. Gardening gloves have more thermal resistance.
review.name: Not what they used to be

review.reviewBody: Picked these up thinking they would be a good addition to the smoker I bought. I was wrong. First use I removed the tray from my smoker the fingers on the glove stopped none of the heat started to burn and left me with burns on my first 3 fingers.
review.name: Glove melted to my finger

review.reviewBody: Perfect set of gloves for grilling and especially for handling hot cast iron skillets.
review.name: Just what I wanted

review.reviewBody: These are super helpful if you have to deal with anything while it's hot, including moving grates around, adjusting the drip tray, or working with probes, smoke tubes, etc. I would not recommend them for handling food directly, but they are great for everything else.
review.name: Gets the jobs done when the heat is on

review.reviewBody: I bought these 2 weeks ago and today my son used them and burned his hands while using the gloves on the grill.

hasVariant.name: Merino 125 Cool-Lite Speed Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Merino 125 Cool-Lite Speed Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Merino 125 Cool-Lite Speed Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought a size L and my bust measurement is 39.5 inches (34H in US bra sizing). I am 5'10" and this shirt is perfect in every way except that it's a little too short in front. The hemline is intentionally scooped so that it's longer in back and shorter in front. When I raise my arms over my head, the front hem is at my ribcage... so it's not very gym friendly, better for an activity like running or maybe hiking, although the back vent means I'd need to apply sunscreen to a rather unreachable part of my back. So this top is probably not going to get as much wear as my other icebreaker t-shirts. It's a cute design and I like the fabric, but the functionality is a little bit compromised for me.
review.name: Good, but I wish it were longer

review.itemreviewed: Merino 125 Cool-Lite Speed Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] shirt is great quality. I wish the brand didn't have their logo in the front center. color is also more brown than I was expecting. overall would only buy again if they stop putting the logo on the shirt.
review.name: love the product. color is browner than I was expecting.

review.itemreviewed: Merino 125 Cool-Lite Speed Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this shirt. Not only is it attractive and the colors are amazing, I bought all three colors, but it keeps me cool running in hot temperatures. I run in the desert up to 96 degrees in these shirts. I wear a medium in other brands but a large in icebreaker tops. The slit in the back makes a nice vent for heat to escape and the shirt flows AWAY from the body which allows for airflow over the skin. The air also flows through this fabric cooling me down and when it is saturated in sweat it still feels cool to the skin. Awesome! Functional and attractive. What more could you want?
review.name: The best shirt for hot weather running

review.itemreviewed: Merino 125 Cool-Lite Speed Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this shirt for working out, it is light weight, feminine and so so cute. I'm purchasing in more colors.
review.name: Cute, Comfy and Practical

name: Merino 125 Cool-Lite Speed Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: Nice tackiness and cushion.  Dimples are well placed.  I‚Äôd call it perfect if the diameter tapered about 2mm inboard
review.name: So close to perfection

review.reviewBody: These grips are awesome. I've got bigger hands and recently went back to some thinner grips after running these for a couple seasons. One ride with new grips and I'm already looking for a new pair of Dreadlocks. Super soft but not so much that they'll shred after one crash. If you've got slightly bigger hands, these should be your go to grips!
review.name: Best Grips on the Market

review.reviewBody: I grabbed these in a shop and held them but didn't ride them.  Comfortable but I was in the fence to spend that much on grips with so many options out there.  Anyway, I finally pulled the trigger and kinda sorry I did.  My real and only complaint is there not at all tacky or grippy when bashing down a trail at speed and with drops and rock gardens.  There's no texture to the grips that my gloves can mesh with and on several occasions I caught myself thanking God my grip didn't completely release from the bar.  They are well made, just don't work for me
review.name: Not tacky

review.reviewBody: I tried several other hiking shoes before getting these, all losers.  The Moab 3 are a sure winner.  It is difficult to find shoes that say they are wide width and actually are wide width.  These are definitely wide width.  So very comfy.  Feel very sturdy on the trails.  Most of our hiking is in the Appalachian Mountains in N. Carolina.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable as soon as I put them on.  The wide toe gives more room making it easier to put on and take off.
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.reviewBody: Nice comfortable shoe with width, and lots of room in the toe box! Well built.
review.name: Very happy with this shoe.

review.reviewBody: Wore my shoes on a week long trip to Colorado. So come!!

review.reviewBody: Great fit, look and support. My planters fasciitis is healing.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and hard wearing. Plenty of space for toes. Best wide feet shoes I've owned!

review.reviewBody: If you‚Äôve been a ‚Äòwalking fool‚Äô like me who needs non-slip vibram for rain forest city rain, and width for orthotics, these shoes are perfect. Thank you

review.reviewBody: Great fit. I'm extremely happy with these shoes and plan on doing plenty of walking in them.  They are very comfortable, with the grip I need. I'm going to use them for my trip to Europe next year.

review.reviewBody:
Everyone asks where I got my shoes . What brand are they?
I like their light weight and perfect fit. I don't always prefer the neutral heel, but it's fine when I wear them more often.
review.name: Good fit, light weight
comment: Thanks for sharing your great feedback!

review.reviewBody: Not what I expected, sorta ugly and uncomfortable.  They look cheaply made nothing soft about them.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: These shoes simply do not fit my foot. Also the left shoe has some quality issues. They are attractive shoes but I need to return them.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable shoes ever ! - great for daily walks with our dog .Hard to wear anything else
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Out of the box, amazing comfort for my feet. I have metatarsalgia so I cannot put pressure on the ball of my foot. I also have hammerhead toes and a bunion on one foot.  The wide toe box, even in the regular size 9, was like a dream come true. The heels of my feet are narrow so I cannot wear a wide size without my feet slipping out.  This style has a lift in the arch. My arches are low, what could be better!  I immediately took advantage of a Merrill offer - and purchased another pair in another color.  I must have tried on 25 pairs of sneakers in the last three months, the Wrapt style sneaker is an oasis for my troubled feet.
review.name: Wide Toe Box and Arch Lift!
comment: Thank you for sharing your experience with us!

review.reviewBody: I believe I just ordered my 14th pair.  I only walk now as I‚Äôll soon be 80. I wouldn‚Äôt wear anything else.  Love Merrills.
review.name: Nana

review.reviewBody: I love love love these shows... so comfortable and goes with most of my wardrobe unless I get really dressed up.
review.name: Love these shoe!

review.reviewBody: Had to return my first pair for a smaller size, and it took me a bit to get used to the wider footbed, but after a few trial trails, I'm a fan!
review.name: Try 'em! You might like 'em

review.reviewBody: I take these sneakers on a 5 mile walk every morning!  I also wear them during the day.  They are so comfortable!  My sister was looking to buy a pair of sneakers and she was going to order a different brand and I told her about Merrell.  She wears them everyday as well.  With her job, she is on her feet most of the day.  She loves them!
review.name: HAPPY WALKER!

review.reviewBody: I have difficult feet to fit. These shoes are soooooo comfortable and supportive.  I had to buy a half size bigger. The return process was easy.  I hope Merrell keeps these shoes available always. I will buy them again.
review.name: Supportive and comfortable
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us.

description: Buy the Fjallraven Totepack No. 2 - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Totepack No. 2 - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Totepack No. 2 - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I use a Fjallraven jacket, beanie and day pack, so believe me when I say this thing is absolute garbage.

1. The backpack 'feature' is very poorly designed - if you carry any more than a single notebook, the weight of it will pull whichever strap you take off first all the way to that side - and since there is no way to have them be even, you'll constantly be trying to make micro adjustments so it sits comfortably on your back.

2.  The laptop sleeve inside doesn't go to the bottom, so if you're carrying just a laptop, it will try and collapse on itself, or fall to that side.

3.  The straps in 'tote mode' will never be even since there isn't any internal structure, so the back side will crumble up and always be slightly longer, so it's constantly sliding the shorter one off if you try and put it over your shoulder.

4.  YOU CANNOT CLEAN IT.  For an outdoor product, from an outdoor company, for an everyday carry, this is trash.

For the money, you're better off buying a backpack AND a separate tote - this does both, but so poorly you'll wish you could return it.
review.name: The answer to a question nobody asked.

review.reviewBody: This was my first Fjallraven bag, and is a consistent favorite. Its tough heavy duty waxed canvas and leather bottom are just sturdy enough to take a beating, and supple enough to fit and mold to your body. Even if you fill it, it stays close to body and won't knock into people in crowds when worn as a backpack. I use this when I am out and about for the day and want to keep my things close, but stay hands free. There is tons of room, without it becoming overwhelming.
review.name: perfect around the town bag

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôm happy with it. Holds a lot of stuff and it‚Äôs a tote when I need it to be and a backpack when I need it. It‚Äôs very durable and I have no complaints.
review.name: I like it

review.reviewBody: It‚Äôs a perfect size for me. I use it as a backpack for short hikes, carryon for travel and it‚Äôs comfortable either way you choose.
review.name: Totepack No. 2 Love

review.reviewBody:
In general, this bag is durable, versatile, yet simple.
There are enough pockets without forgetting where you put items. I felt the shoulder straps are a bit long. I‚Äôve used both options, as a tote and as a backpack.
review.name: Sturdy bag.

review.reviewBody: I've used this bag for a couple of months now and I love it! I've used at Trade Shows collecting catalogs and around town shopping. I love the adjustability of the straps, I've worn as a back pack several times and it's comfortable! The leather bottom really holds up well to all the environments I've subjected it to! Just a super versatile tote!
review.name: This bag is AWESOME!

review.reviewBody: I use this Totepack daily for work, and on occasion for weekend trips, shopping expeditions, and sporting events. The size is perfect and the fact that it can be a handbag, shoulder bag, or backpack, is what makes it. One bag serves many purposes.
review.name: Great versatile bag

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this tote. It is generous in size without being bulky, the straps are the perfect length and it wears well. I‚Äôd purchase in all colors if they were available.
review.name: The best tote...ever!

review.reviewBody: I live the shape and depth of this bag. The handles that turn into backpack shoulder straps is genius.
review.name: Great bag

name: Totepack No. 2 - Women's

review.reviewBody:
It‚Äôs hard to find a ski that goes uphill this well - and is still fun and stable downhill.  At 910 grams it‚Äôs not much heavier than a full on skimo race but it would be much faster on icy or hard packed conditions.  I haven‚Äôt tried the new skin system that uses the pin hole - I just used the notch for a race type skin.  The ski has a reputation for being unforgiving but I didn‚Äôt find that to be the case and I don‚Äôt consider myself to be an expert skier.  I put a Dynafit Race 150 binding on the ski which has worked great with my Scarpa F1 LT boots.

Highly recommended for citizen racing or super fast touring and both backcountry and in-area skinning and skiing.
review.name: Race ski or fast touring?

name: Blacklight Pro Ski - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Crestwood Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots were a second choce for me, but I'm really happy with them. They cost more than my first choice selection, but promise to be waterproof, which the old ones were not at all. So far they are a decent hiking boot. They are supportive and sturdy and are more waterproof than my older Columbias. It remains to be seen how that holds up in really wet weather. I'm a female but prefer men's hiking boots as they are a bit roomier so its nice this model comes in smaller sizes.
review.name: Sturdywaterproof hiking boot in smaller mens size.

name: Crestwood Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest RidgeRest Classic Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: RidgeRest Classic Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest RidgeRest Classic Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Works great for the extra insulation/cushioning I wanted. Happy that this quality product is still being made.
review.name: Works great for the extra

review.reviewBody: I use it under my inflatable sleeping pad or throw it down for the dogs. Not much to say about these type of foam mats since there is nothing fancy going on here but out of the options this is one of the best. its taken a beating and still going. Ive used it as a sleeping pad, dog mat, rolled up and used as a seat cushion on rocks, a pillow, vestibule door mat and tent footprint on a 1 man tent, if i was a little lighter id try it as a raft.
review.name: One of the best for what it is.

review.reviewBody: Owned one before and liked it but have evolved to a big agnes q core deluxe pad however im doing a 242 mile river trip in october and wanted a back up pad should the q core pad experience issues. I have repair kits, but having the ridgerest pad there in addition gives me of mind that no matter what, im protected from the hard cold ground.
review.name: Owned one before and liked

review.reviewBody: The size is great, and I'm almost 6', but the sleeping pad is hard. The hard surface combined with ridges makes it even more uncomfortable than if it were smooth. I would have preferred a softer version.
review.name: Too hard

review.reviewBody: I have yet to use it but I will be trying it out soon!!! I have a feeling it will be amazing like all Therm-A-Rest products :).
review.name: Perfect for bushcraft, backpacking and minimalist car camping!!

review.reviewBody:
I have had your almost identical Ridgerest mat for about 5 years. I adore everything about it. I use it for yoga/meditation/stretching at home. 
The new mat is about 6-8 inches longer.
Prefer the shorter one.
review.name: Prefer older, shorter version

review.reviewBody:
I love these old school RidgeRest Classic's. I keep them in my cars, and my shed, and around the house. Any time I have to get down on my knees or look under my car or exercise on the floor / ground. They do the trick.

My only disappointment is that they were only offered in the largest size when I purchased recently. For my purposes, the old medium size was perfect. I plan to cut these down but I just haven't gotten around to it.
review.name: Excellent all-purpose use

review.reviewBody: Used it on my cot and was surprised how much different the temperature was without it. Light weight, good bang for your buck.
review.name: Used it on my cot

review.reviewBody:
I bought the RidgeRest Classic for a camping trip in Great Smoky Mountains National Park.

I had been using a backpacking inflatable (small) sleeping pad from another company. This pad kept deflating during the night and got holes in it too easily.

I needed a pad that would not get holes in it and could survive if my three year old and 18 month old children decided to be monkeys in the tent.

The RidgeRest Classic seems light and rolls up nicely into a compact shape for packing. It is made from a material that can withstand rugged conditions but is also comfortable for sleeping.
review.name: Great Value for the Price!

review.reviewBody: Perfect, straight forward, not fancy... can't poke a hole in it! Used the pads for years... glad to see the pad available again!
review.name: Perfect, straight forward, not fancy...

name: RidgeRest Classic Sleeping Pad
RidgeRest Classic Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: I tried this helmet on in a store and I really liked the way it is shaped and fits compared to other helmets I tried. It wraps snugly around the  jaw and cheekbones (albeit with thick padding for comfort), for a very secure fit that won't easily move backward, as compared with other helmets I tried that left a gap and did not inspire confidence in the face protector. The feel is closer to a motorcycle helmet. It was a little on the heavy side, so just not what I was looking for on local wooded trails. They had a lighter-weight version but the fit was not as good. Also, the sizing seemed peculiar in that I was an "XL-XXL" even though I am an "L" in most helmet brands.
review.name: Great fit, very secure feeling

review.reviewBody: One of three pairs of shoes I brought to travel Europe for 2 months and am so glad I did! Super comfortable even after 5+ miles daily on uneven cobblestone streets, and versatile enough to wear in basically any context. I have received so many compliments. First few wears yielded some blisters on my heel from the strap, but that hasn‚Äôt been a problem since. One of my favorite pairs of shoes I‚Äôve ever bought!!
review.name: Perfect travel shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a trip to Italy and they have been phenomenal! We‚Äôve been walking at least 6 miles a day and I‚Äôve had no blisters and my feet feel fine. They do fairly well on cobblestone, but I‚Äôd recommend breaking them in a bit to soften up the strap. The traction is also pretty good, and I‚Äôve only been slightly concerned on smooth old stone stairs when it‚Äôs raining. I wouldn‚Äôt hike in them, but they are otherwise a great activity shoe. The buckle gets easier to use after 5ish wears.
review.name: A perfect cute walking sandal

review.reviewBody: These lovely sandals are so pretty and comfortable. I usually wear a 10 on Sorel tennis shoes and boots, but my last two pair of sandals I have sized down to 9.5, but only in platform sandals.
review.name: Beautiful & Comfortable

review.reviewBody: These sandals fit my feet perfectly and are incredibly comfortable. I do have a high arch and there really isn‚Äôt any arch support but they are still comfortable to wear anyway. Look and feel very high quality.
review.name: Fantastic for narrow feet!

review.reviewBody: Gorgeous and comfortable. A smidge small. But very wearable. Bought two pairs. One in black and one tan. Best summer sandal. Every day wear.
review.name: Beautiful

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased a pair of Sorel shoes and I couldn't be happier with my decision. 
The comfort level of these shoes is outstanding, providing excellent support and cushioning throughout the day. Whether I'm running errands or taking a leisurely walk, my feet feel great. 
Additionally, the build quality is top-notch, with durable materials that ensure longevity. Stylish and functional, these Sorel shoes are a fantastic addition to my footwear collection. Highly recommended!
review.name: Great Shoes!! Highly RECOMMENDED!!

review.reviewBody: I have been wanting a pair of Sorel sandals for sometime now.  I'm heading to Europe in a month so I wanted to take one shoe that could go from day to night and was neutral - one that I didn't have to worry about breaking in. I couldn't be more thrilled with this shoe!!  Instantly it was comfortable and I've been finding excuses to wear it everyday.  It's not super light, however it will be fine in my backpack.  The leather is soft and the shoe is very well made.  It performs well on uneven surfaces as well.  Highly recommend!!
review.name: This Shoe Belongs in Everyone's Closet!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes! The size 5 fit perfect which is rare for me. The buckle was stiff at first, however after wearing the shoes a couple of times it is limber and easy to fasten. I get compliments on these shoes every time I wear them!
review.name: Love Yello!

review.reviewBody: These just didn't hit the mark. Nothing special or stylish about them. The buckle was super difficult to maneuver and fasten. Returned
review.name: Not a keeper
comment: Hello MHOdges, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry DAYSPRING‚Ñ¢ Ankle Strap Women's Platform Sandal didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody:
This is my first pair of platform sandals and i LOVE these. Sometimes I don't like when my toes peak out but the strap over the top of my foot is just perfect and comfortable. Very true to size too, so was stoked that the size I usually order was correct!

I was a little nervous with the platform part being tippy, but theses are a solid foundation. I didn't feel like I was going to roll an ankle at all and some decent walking was comfortable for me!

Now summer needs to arrive!
review.name: So cute!

name: Dayspring Ankle Strap Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my wife‚Äôs bike, they set up tubeless really easily, she‚Äôs quite happy.
review.name: Great tires at a great price

review.reviewBody:
Just mounted these last week and have ridden them a couple of times. Getting the tire on the wheel was comparable to my experience with other tires on the same wheelset. These seemed more difficult to get the edge bead to seat in the rim than the last pair of Continental tires I had. I couldn't get these with my pump but didn't have any issues once I switched to an air compressor. Maybe it was because cold outside and the rubber was stiff. These sealed up well and seem to hold pressure better than my last set of tires. 

The ride quality is good. I feel like they ride a little smoother than past tires at the same pressure. Grip seems good. 

Overall, I am happy with my purchase.
review.name: So Far So Good

review.reviewBody:
I have found that all road tubeless tires can take time to install but the Schwalbe One is easy to mount if you follow the instructions.  I use a microfiber cloth with soapy water and lube up both sides of the tire bead.  I use a AirShot tubeless tire inflator and the tire seats very easily. 

If I get a hole in the tire I might have to use a Dynaplug and the Orange Sealant usually will stop the loss of air.  I usually don't have to remove the tire but I have found that if I do I can get a inner tube tire patch and patch the hole from the inside and get more miles out of the tire.

The sidewall seems to be the only weak spot that you want to avoid rocks or sharp objects that might cut it.

I have ridden these tires on gravel, unintentionally, and done very well.  Didn't realize that there would be miles of a gravel section in the Mirror Lake Highway race in Utah but did it twice without any issues.

Great tires and will usually last longer than many of the other bigger brand name tires I have tried.  I usually ride over 5,000 a year so it is nice not to have to replace tires every 1,500 miles or so.
review.name: I got over 5,000 on a One TLE!

review.reviewBody: Tires do not fit. Easier to cut them off than risk damaging the wheels. There is no way thes get installed onto a 700c wheel. Schwalbe should let you skip the step of shipping these and just throw them strait into the trash.
review.name: Worthless!!! Do not buy
comment:
I agree that these tires fit tight onto a rim, but a little bit of patience and the right tool will mount and un-mount them fine.  On the road, carry some Pedro's levers and work the bead a bit to get a tube mounted in a pinch.  I'd rather they fit tight than loose obviously if running tubeless, easier to get the tire to seal and lower risk of a roll off if there is a puncture.
As for how the tires perform, I've had one set mounted for 9 months with little wear, and they lasted through the fall and spring with road debris.  
I've mounted and used many different tires for mtb, cx, and road; I can't say these are the worse for mounting but they certainly aren't the easiest.  I find Vittoria tires to be the most difficult to be honest.  But with the right tool (don't try to mount by hand or with tire levers, use an actual mounting tool) the job is much easier.

name: One Performance Tire - Tubeless

review.reviewBody: Awesome trailer! Has allowed me to take longer adventures with my toddler.
review.name: Awesome trailer! Has allowed me

review.reviewBody: Our family really likes this trailer. It has a simple design, it‚Äôs light weight, and stores very easily. I was pleased with just how easy it was to pack away into a car for family bike tripes. One complaint is that there is little air circulation. My son was very hot. One improvement would be to allow the sides to fold down instead of having g plastic windows.
review.name: Simple, light, but hot

review.reviewBody: The two seater bee has shrunk. It‚Äôs now too small for two children. We are a rental company and have a number of these that we replace regularly. We were caught off guard when the new replacements arrived. We will no longer be using this brand. Not recommended.
review.name: Shrunken bee

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of Burley trailers. This is the fourth one I've bought, and this one is for my friends and their daughter. So far I've used it to ride her to the playground and also to haul my camping gear on a 4 day camping trip. It was heavier than panniers for the camping gear, but still worked fine. It's perfect for riding around a kid. I love how easily it folds up to put in a car. The hitch is super easy to use, and I bought an extra hitch so that we can switch it between bikes. It looks super cute and it rides so smooth I can barely feel it behind me, except going up hills. It road great on some dirt roads an even a brief bit of single track.
review.name: sturdy, convenient, and fun

review.reviewBody: My kid and I love the bee! It‚Äôs so light that when we are on flat ground I can‚Äôt even feels the extra weight. Going over bridges is definitely harder but not impossible. We use it everyday.
review.name: Love the bee

review.reviewBody: Baby loves it and went right to sleep! Easy to assemble and it's great that it folds to store. Rides smooth with great visibility. Thank you!
review.name: Baby loves it and went

review.reviewBody: It is truly an investment‚Ä¶ It brought me back outdoors. I go on runs and I go on bike rides and it feel so nice to be able to be myself again and bring my toddler to enjoy the things I did waaaaaay before he came into this world. I don‚Äôt live in a safe neighborhood so I usually have to drive to a park or trail to use my burley.. I can 100% tell you that everything including my bike and baby fit in my RAV4. It‚Äôs so easy to disassemble and pack away. I love this product and would definitely recommend others to buy!
review.name: Helped me get active again

review.reviewBody: I bought for my son and daughter in law and they love it. They have 2 young kids and are very active.
review.name: Great gift

review.reviewBody: The Burley Bee is incredibly built with plenty of places to attach tail and head lights. The kids love it and are perfectly comfortable even on 30 degree days. There is tons of storage space, making it easy to stay out all day long.
review.name: This thing is a game changer

review.reviewBody: Easy assembly/disassembly, quick install and a smooth ride. My little one loved it and hopefully it gets lots of mileage!
review.name: Perfect

hasVariant.name: Vector Alpine Cargo Box
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Vector Alpine Cargo Box online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Basically made the the roofline of a wagon. Thule nailed this one. Build quality is superior to any of their other models. Handles high speeds no problem. The interior LED light is a nice touch. It‚Äôs definitely not the largest by volume, but it‚Äôs held all my snow or bike gear no problem. Worth the $
review.name: Best box on the market

review.reviewBody: I love the style and ease of locking/closing for this storage box. It is just much smaller than I expected.
review.name: Far better locking and closing

review.reviewBody: Bought this about a month ago for my Audi SQ5, to transport snowboards to and from the mountain. Today was suppose to be its maiden voyage from MA to VT I went outside this morning, temperature was 10 degrees. Could not open the box. The key would literally not even fit into the hole. It appears they manufacture the locks out of a very soft steel and in those temps the metal must have shrunk to a point where the key would not go into the hole at all on either side. It‚Äôs 5pm now, just got home and key still won‚Äôt go in and still can‚Äôt open the box. If you plan to use this in cold weather don‚Äôt bother.
review.name: This roof box looks good but that‚Äôs about it‚Ä¶
comment:
Thank you for sharing your experience with the Thule Vector Alpine. 
I understand your frustrations with the operational issues the cargo carrier experienced due to low temperatures. While cold weather lock operational troubles are an inconvenience, they are not uncommon for any material operating in below-freezing temperatures. We do our best at Thule to design products that can withstand the limits of the outdoor conditions they are used in, but that does not prevent the properties of the materials used from being affected by their environments. Steel of any kind will naturally shrink in cold weather, as you noted in your review. This can occur on car door locks, as well. 
Warming up the key and mechanism prior to use can help the function of the lock. Easy ways to accomplish this include holding the key somewhere close to a source of body heat for a few minutes prior to use and breathing into the lock to warm up the tumblers. Commercial lock de-icer is also a great tool to use in these circumstances as it is designed explicitly for this purpose.¬†
I am sure that you will find these troubleshooting measures to be effective in using your Thule Vector Alpine in cold-weather conditions without much issue.

review.reviewBody: We picked up the Vector to replace our old Atlantis, such a great upgrade. The LED lighting is one of our favorite touches.
review.name: Best Roof Box Around

review.reviewBody: I bought this a couple of weeks ago, and the quality exceeds my expectations and beats my old roof box from another brand I had. I will not go back to any other box.
review.name: Best roof box quality.

review.reviewBody: I received the Vector Alpine box, mounted it on my SUV to use for ski trips and have been very please so far. The structure is rigid and very solid with clearly high quality plastics. Although it is a bit heavy and requires two people to mount it, the added durability will be great over time. The way the front edge swoops down is a unique aesthetic and definitely stands out from the crowd of boxy boxes!
review.name: High quality and great aesthetics

review.reviewBody:
HI There,
I recently purchase a Thule Vector Alpine XL.
Very nice product, except that the lock are really tight and sometimes I'm unable to open the box. Plus where to I get the batterie for the lights in Canada?
review.name: Batterie and lock ???

review.reviewBody: Love the look, love the storage space. Super easy install and removal. Box came damaged from XPO but carrier looked fine upon initial inspection looked fine. Installed with plastic still on‚Ä¶when removing plastic, there was a huge scratch. Not thrilled about price tag, and receiving damaged product. Outside of the damage, the final product and final look were exactly what we wanted.
review.name: Awesome for extra storage

review.reviewBody: I've owned the box for about a year now and never really knew that it should come with the led's, Thule help?
review.name: No LED's on my Vector Alpine???
comment:
Thank you for letting us know about the missing component to your Thule Vector Alpine. 
A Thule representative would be happy to assist with that issue through a warranty claim. You can get that process started through the Thule.com Warranty page:
https://www.thule.com/en-us/about-thule/warranty

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôm very happy with my new roof box. Other than it looks amazing when in the need for additional vehicle storage, it truly is a great tool for a sporting or outdoor family on the go
review.name: Great addition to family storage while commuting

name: Vector Alpine Cargo Box

review.reviewBody: Easy to trim and set up, done quickly by a beginner.
review.name: Easy to trim and set

review.reviewBody: Easy to cut and install, they glide like a cloud up the mountain.
review.name: Glide Right

review.reviewBody: Good quality skins. They come uncut and I was able to cut them myself. Recommend filing down the screws after you trim them so they are flush.
review.name: Compatible with different splitboards

review.reviewBody: Recent purchase, but so far so good after 4 days of touring in the San Juans. We are transitioning into spring time conditions here so I am curious to see how they will handle a spring time skin track, but so far the grip and glide have been great.
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: yay! so happy to have new skins again, easy to assemble... except if you have protectionist tendencies, otherwise its like, ya know, measure once cut once. A new how-to video would be greatly appreciated!
review.name: new skins!

review.reviewBody: These are amazing! Don't think these won't grip as well as the ascensions because they are so grippy and have the glide that the ascensions don't. They pack down so nicely and the glue has been great from my years of using BD skins. If these are in stock, get em while there available because they go quickly in the shop.
review.name: Best Skins for a Cardiff Splitboard!

review.reviewBody: I got these skins as a professional avalanche educator and splitboard guide, curious about the new combo mohair nylon. I think I got ones with a bad batch of glue but in my experience the old grey glidelite skins not only worked better, they seem to be a little smaller/more packable and have a better glide/grip combo.
review.name: Ok but not as good as the old Glidelite

review.reviewBody: Best skins I've used to date, including other BD skins and Pomocas. They do everything well, get yourself a pair!
review.name: Light, stick well, glide great, grip gorgeously

review.name: Purchased as a gift for

review.reviewBody: As you‚Äôd expect from Osprey, this pack is very well made. I‚Äôve only used it a few times for day hikes around Devon/Dartmoor area, but if it‚Äôs anything like the Talon10 that I‚Äôve been using for mountain biking for about a decade I‚Äôll be a happy man. And if I have any issues at all the Osprey guarantee is second to none in my opinion.
review.name: So far so good.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bag back in 2015. I use it for work, travels (domestic/international) skiing, hiking, fourteeners, biking, rock climbing/bouldering, cruise travel and light camping (use the manta 34 for real camping). This pack I use it daily, it is my go to bag, work, fun, or travel it is very versatile and awesome. For travel, I was able to pack 4 day trip (I pack light with compress bag) easily. Comfortable straps, easy to use with all the access pocket and water bladder/pocket on the side. The bag went through a lot with me, after all this year it is still in good shape, just recently sent it in for repair/ life time guarantee. Once I get it back I re-edit this. 
Short story short this bag is fantastic for outdoor activity and hiking. It is very versatile, not water proof but definitely water resistant. Went on a few hike and got stuck in the rain storm (Colorado rain) some items in the bag were still dry but some were wet. Great material that will with stand the terrain that I put it through. Mesh bag in the front is awesome for quick access for light jacket. Trek poles/ice pick holder are great and easy to strap on and carry. Big pocket to put everything in, small inside pocket to put keys and personal item. Front small pocket to put in eyeglasses or snack for quick access. 2 pocket on the hip straps that you can put more snack, lipbalm, hand sanitizer or what ever they fit there. The straps is Snug and hold to body for activity.
Highly recommend this bag for anyone who likes out door activity. Highly recommend this bag, after 9 years of using this almost daily, it is the first time I sent it in for repair. Can‚Äôt wait to get it back or hear from osprey about the bag.
review.name: Talon 22 worth it

review.reviewBody: Thank you for caring about us rounder people. It has been a while since I have been on the trail and I have gained a lot of weight. I was not shocked to find that there is not a lot of choices at the local shops for us fat people. There were a few other company's pack that would have worked, however you could tell it was just an after thought. I am 6 foot 7, and 360ish pounds the EF XL fits me and does not look like I am carrying an ant on my back. It has more features than the pack I used 20+ years ago and weights much less. The construction feels solid and should hold up. Again I do not know who came up with the EF idea, but I am sure I can speak for us fat people when I say thank you.
review.name: Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I bought this 2 months ago and have used it on two Colorado 14er hikes and several day  long hikes across traverses in Summit and Eagle Counties.  It's perfect for an all day hike.  It holds my 3 liter bladder and two 20 oz water bottles along with a puffy, a rain shell and miscellaneous stuff like a survival knife, bear spray, bug spray, first aid kit, gloves, hat and a few sandwiches.  The hip belt pockets are nice for bars, iPhone, chapstick and small tube of sunscreen.  It's comfortable to wear and rides slightly above waistline.  The bladder is a bit of a challenge to get in and out but not a big deal in my opinion.  Overall this is a great pack, and I would buy it again and recommend it for others who want an ideal size pack for all day trips.
review.name: Great features and capacity

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Its a really good "f√∂rst√§rkningsjacka" as we call it. Its ofcourse intended as a layer for example under a shell jacket. I use it also stand alone with base layer and thin vest under in milder weather. For a "stand alone" jacket I use either Keb Touring Down or Keb Expedion.
review.name: Does good job used as intended

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Loved the look and feel of this jacket and was hoping to use as a mid layer and have as an option milder MN winter days. I'm 6'3" and about 260 and bought an XXL. Just felt too tight through the arms and chest. Would have loved to keep it but ended up sending it back in. 

Will watch hoping they come out with a 3XL!
review.name: Looked Great but a bit Small For me

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for a trip to the Baltic States. The weather was above freezing but windy, great and misty most of the trip. The coldest day was blustery just above freezing. The jacket provided little warmth and no protection from the wind. I have other Fjallraven products and this is the only one I'm not happy with. I ordered a medium and it felt closer to a large.
review.name: Not For Cold Weather

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket. I‚Äôve had a Patagonia nano puff coat for 6-7 years and was in need upgrade. Very happy with my purchase! This jacket is very warm and I love the material. Super soft. Great for everyday use. I typically wear a medium but purchased a large so I could wear sweatshirts underneath if needed. Size fits well. I would purchase this jacket again.
review.name: Great everyday coat!

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I thought it was me, when I wore this jacket with 2 layers beneath and I was cold in 5degrees C but it seems others feel the same way. I agree with the other reviewers that it looks good and is a very good fit, but I have been buying Fjallraven for 24 years and I expect to be kept warm in a jacket called ‚ÄúExpedition‚Äù. For an expedition to the shops on a mild autumn day it‚Äôs fine, but I expect better from Fjallraven.
review.name: Don‚Äôt go out in the cold!

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Real nice jacket. Very comfortable and feels warm and durable. The high neck when zipped up gives a lot of protection. Only thing is I may have to send it back due to the fit. The arms are very long. They bunch up at the elbow when worn normally. This would be my 5th jacket from Fjallraven and a medium always fit perfectly but not this one for some reason.
review.name: Nice Coat but Fits Odd

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I live in the US southeast and the sweater parka's from the typical name brands work just fine for the winter months here. However, I do travel west to snow ski each year and the sweater parka is just a little too light for me for the go to dinner / walk around & shop in ski town temperatures in the US western mountains.

Of course for my evening activities, I could wear my on the mountain ski jacket but I'm vain and would rather be more subtle with my evening wear from what I wear on the mountain. :-)

This Expedition Pack Down Hoodie is the perfect balance of what I was looking for! I did not want to spend / did not need the features and bulk of hyper warm parka. I wanted an easy plane travel jacket and something a bit more substantial than those sweater parkas I mentioned above. Did I mention vanity? I wanted a jacket to look cool. 
 
I found this sweet spot in the Expedition Pack Down Hoodie.

It is more substantial than the sweater parkas I mentioned above. Both in down insulation and also the hood addition for those hopeful nights it is snowing at dinner which means I have to get up early for first tracks. Keeps me warmer on those evening nights without the expense of expedition gear.

It looks cool. I went with navy but regardless of the base color, I really love the subtley of the yellow in the hood pulls. I also love the logo of Fjallraven. Not gonna lie, I didn't know the Fjallraven brand until I stumbled upon the brand in a store, started my internet research, which resulted in my purchase.

This jacket will be my "this is what I wear and/or stuff into my backpack for my flight from the southeast to the moutains, will be my go to dinner/walk/shop around the ski mountain town nights, wear for my depressing flight home."

And look cool the entire trip too!
review.name: Perfect balance

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Superb piece from Fjallraven used recently on a trip to Tromso Norway. Jacket was worn as part of a layering system during snow storms and dog sledding and I didn‚Äôt feel the cold once with temps down to -10. Great for expedition or chilling around town. Stuffs away nicely to use as a pillow. Highly recommend ‚ùÑÔ∏è
review.name: Top Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the look and fit, but the quality of the down filling on the whole backside of the hoody is terrible. There is almost no down inside. The front side and arms are ok. Very disappointed.
review.name: Bad quality

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a down jacket with highest quality and real material
review.name: Wondering jacket

review.reviewBody:
I‚Äôve been riding on these shoes for about a month now. This shoe has top of the line stiffness and comfort. I‚Äôm coming off three pairs of Shimano S-PHYRE‚Äôs, and this shoe is very comparable to the top of the line S-PHYRE. 

The only thing I would point out with this shoe is it‚Äôs very tight to your feet. But after a few adjustments and not tightening the second dial as tight, I‚Äôve found a very comfortable median. 

Great buy for the price!
review.name: Great Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody: Great fit, easy to gear up and ride with these!
review.name: Love these !

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôve had a few pairs of shimano road shoes. This one was too tight when others were ok. I found the wide shoes were too wide. In this shoe size regular, the toe box is too small. It just didn‚Äôt work this time
review.name: Too tight for my foot-great quality tho

review.reviewBody: I am very pleased with the shoes, especially at this price point. I like them better than my previous shoes, which were S-Phyres from one or two models prior. Like the S-Phyres, they now have 2 BOAs, and the carbon insert is longer. The fit is fantastic when sized properly, with no excess material. My previous shoes were a 1/2 size too small (46.5 on the European sizing scale, like what I wore in SIDI). The shape was great just no room for my foot to expand. Stepping it up the 1/2 size to 47.0 on these did the trick and I wish I had done it sooner.
review.name: Great shoe at a moderate price

review.reviewBody: The shoes felt amazing and easy to move in unlike others I have tried on. I would highly recommend these to my friend. As the description said, go 1 size up for better comfort.
review.name: Love the shoes

review.reviewBody: These shoes are pretty sturdy, comfortable, and light.  I had a fall and the material held up good and kept my feet protected.  Left shoe now has a little hole but 0 injuries to foot.
review.name: Super Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a wide shoe and these did not come close. It's hard to buy bike shoes online and the stores have such limited options. I'll keep trying
review.name: Shoe width too narrow

review.itemreviewed: Law Fleece Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Let's be honest.  This is a durable canvas jacket in the mold of Carhartt that will be purchased by people who may not be in a trade, but want the look (myself included).  The most work this sees is bringing in firewood from outside.  I purchased the carbon color because I wanted something a little different than your typical brown and very happy with it.
Here's what I really like.  Fleece interior body and quilted arms keep things generally very warm.  Canvas construction cuts down on wind penetration, as well as the elastic rear skirt.  Additional coverage on the...um... rear is big plus too.  Both interior and exterior chest pocket provides options.
Where I really dislike this jacket are the front pockets.  They're small and don't hold a phone well.  The pocket zippers though are the real problem.  While heavy duty, every time you put your hands in the pockets, you feel like you're cutting up the cuffs.  Leave them zipped open and it feels like a chain saw against the sleeves as your arms move back and forth.  If the opening was bigger, I wonder if it would eliminate those two issues.
Otherwise a really nice and functional jacket.
review.name: If it weren't for those pocket zippers

review.reviewBody: Wish it was a titch bigger and that it didn't narrow at the bottom. Otherwise very comfortable. Brought it with me to hike timp. It was packed to the brim. Love the shoulder strap pockets!
review.name: Good for short day hikes

review.reviewBody: Love this for short hikes/treks. It would be perfect if it had a wider bottom.
review.name: Great item

review.reviewBody: See the two plastic clips on the cinch straps where your shoulder blades sit? Those dig into your back while wearing this pack. If that wasn't bad enough the little clip to hold the secondary pouch up is so loose that merely putting the bag on unclips it so it's dangling behind you. Do not trust the reviews for this bag. Very disappointed. There's no way any of the reviewers wore this bag. Terrible comfort because of the plastic clips pressing into your back.
review.name: Terrible design

review.reviewBody: I used it for a couple day hikes. Very light and comfortable..I really liked the shoulder strap pocket to hold my phone.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Great for small hikes or day trips. It's small but can fit water and a small towel or change of clothes. Love the cell phone front pocket.
review.name: Great for small outings!

review.reviewBody: The Trail Lite 12 is the perfect size for a day hike. It has enough room for everything you might need. Very sturdy and well-made! Even has a compartment for a bladder.
review.name: Awesome Daypack!

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack for day hikes and it's absolutely perfect. Great size and plenty of room for everything you need for hiking. Very well made and sturdy. I definitely recommend this pack!
review.name: Perfect day hike backpack

review.reviewBody: Great pack. Comfortable to wear. Storage is well thought out and very handy. The only gripe I would have is the 12 liter size doesn't hold much. Which is completely solvable by ordering the 20l or 24l size. Great if you're going for minimal gear. Size/weight.
review.name: Does what it's supposed to do.

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack for traveling. I bought mainly for the two shoulder strap pockets and two easy to use drink side pockets. Pros: Two easy to use side pockets for drink or small umbrellas. Outer small zipper for easy access small items. Front drawstring for easy a light jacket. Two different pockets on the shoulder straps which makes it easy access for traveling. I can put hand sanitizer, phone, card or my small pocket Osmo 3 Cons: wish the shoulder straps had more padding. Wish there was a smaller zipped container in the biggest compartment for small items. Wish the bottom of the backpack was a bigger diameter matching the top portion. It is relatively smaller than the top portion of the backpack.
review.name: For Travel Use

review.reviewBody: Great! Used it on a 14er last weekend and it fit everything needed. Holds my 2.5L blatter. Convenient pockets for your phone and snacks.
review.name: Top Notch Trail Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used this for skiing and it was a perfect fit and super warm!!
review.name: Perfect to stay warm!

review.reviewBody: I love the plush fleece and how warm the hoodie is. But the hood is so small and tight that it's uncomfortable and looks a bit ridiculous. Also, when I fully zip up the zipper it's a bit uncomfortable too. I'm not the biggest person but I am tall. 5'9" 150 lbs and I ordered the medium. I ended up returning it because of the hood and zipper issue.
review.name: Warm and cozy, but the hood is too small

review.reviewBody: I love this sweatshirt! It?s soft, warm, chic and comfortable. Can?t wait to wear it more especially when it?s really cold.
review.name: So soft and warm

review.reviewBody: I got this to replace a TNF pullover fleece that I got as a gift when I was 16yo. For reference I am now 37 and the the old fleece is still functional but worn and elastic has seen better days. That said I am thrilled with the new fleece. It is so cozy! Be aware that it is very warm to the point of a winter coat so it isn't going to be comfortable when the house is 70. But it is awesome to toss on and head outside when the weather is 40 or less outside. My kids snuggle up with me just to feel the soft fleece. I bought a small and usually wear a small so I am happy with the sizing. I wish it had thumb holes. Otherwise its a great purchse.
review.name: So Cozy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought two of the black. Wow, this is the warmest, coziest, slim fit hoodie and its probably the best hoodie I own. As with all North Face, I'm always an XS. For reference I'm 5'1 98 lbs. I love the zipper kangaroo pocket, the longer length, and the slim fit. This is not a boxy fit hoodie. If you want it more roomier then order 1 size up. The quality and materials used are top notch. This hoodie is worth the price
review.name: Cozy slim fit hoodie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband bought this for me in January. I have only worn this a handful of times. Today I noticed a hole in my pocket area at the top. I do not put any heavy items in that pocket. The few times I've worn it, is when I'm cold on my couch, so no strenuous activity. Also, washing is a nightmare and the fabric looks weird after one wash. Save your money and spend it on something of higher quality. I am so disappointed.
review.name: Do not buy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So warm and extremely comfortable
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love that it's perfect for cool weather. Can even be a little too warm if you wear it indoors, but great to ward off a chill. Fun pattern and very soft.
review.name: This is the coziest sweatshirt I own!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like to layer my hoodie for extra warmth for walks and its perfect for driving not bulky.
review.name: Very colorful and comfy.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Who knew a pullover fleece could be so absolutely wonderful? I don't know where to begin in describing its stellar attributes. The gorgeous navy/yellow/white flowers? The unbelievably soft material that envelops me in a warm hug? The hood that keeps my neck toasty? The perfect fit...longer, hitting at the hips and roomy enough to not be restricting? All of the above are reasons I have not once regretted my choice of this truly divine pullover fleece.
review.name: Divine. Sumptuous. Comfort. Yes, it's a fleece. But--wow!

review.reviewBody: The hats were for my sons. They both like them and they're warm. One son son is in a wheelchair and likes to sit outside so this hat hat is perfect for cool days.
review.name: Yes I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: A birthday gift for my son and he absolutely loves the jacket and the hat!
review.name: A great birthday gift

review.reviewBody: I purchased this beanie for my son to match his jacket and it fits perfectly. I've already purchased other colors.
review.name: A must have

review.reviewBody: Mom loves her hat I purchased it to go with her northface parka
review.name: Best hands down

review.reviewBody: Love this color & nice & warm
review.name: My favorite

review.reviewBody: Great fit and it's warm. I have thick, long hair and a lot of it, so most hats make their way off my head with regular movement. This one (the regular length, not the shorter one) stays mostly in place and doesn't ride up off my forehead!
review.name: Fits great, even with lots of hair!

review.reviewBody: This TNF Beanie is a best product, keep my head warm and my ideas as well
review.name: I would like to buy this product againg

review.reviewBody: Great beanie very warm and comfortable!!! Surprisingly tight weave, which makes it very wind proof.. I can feel that because I shave my head!!
review.name: Tight weave, warm and wind proof!

review.reviewBody: Hat fits perfectly. I wear a 7 1/2 in fitted hats and some times knit hats run small and don't fit right. Not this one fits great. Got the Earthen Copper and love the color.
review.name: New favorite hat

name: Logo Box Cuffed Beanie

review.reviewBody: I've been climbing in the Solution harness for over 10 years now. This harness is my go to for hard sport sends and big days in the alpine. It really does do it all. The material is light, but not so light that it's uncomfortable and creates pinch points. I'm a huge fan and will continue to re-up on this rig for years to come.
review.name: Best Workhorse on the Market

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and the updated version seems to have better fitting leg loops. Only minor complaint is the gear loops are a bit small but that is coming from someone that prefers trad. Overall a great harness.
review.name: Super comfy and the updated

review.reviewBody: This harness feels super light when wearing it, like it‚Äôs barely there. I was worried about the lack of adjustability, but it just‚Ä¶ fits. Leg straps are really comfortable when belaying or hanging. I‚Äôm a fan.
review.name: Like wearing air

review.reviewBody: Durable and lightweight. Very abrasion resistant fabric construction. Great fit. My favorite harness I‚Äôve had so far. Highly recommended.
review.name: My favorite.

review.reviewBody: Been out climbing a few times since my purchase. None the less super comfy and quality for black diamond. No complaints. 10/10
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: The Men's Solution Harness is my go to harness. I sit in my harness for hours bolting routes, and it is the best for comfort and quality.
review.name: Comfortable and Durable

review.reviewBody: I've only just started using this harness but it seems bomber and very comfy.
review.name: comfy

review.reviewBody: Love the Solution harness and I‚Äôm rest assured with Black Diamond‚Äôs construction and safety adherence.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: I had one for 3 years and just got another one because I want a different color. It‚Äôs very light and comfortable, the best harness I‚Äôve ever used.
review.name: Light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I've only climbed in this once, but I had a fair amount of partial-weight hang time on a multi-pitch slab climb. Super comfortable and light weight from my layman's perspective. I *might* miss the adjustable leg loops for flexibility, but hardly anything to complain about! Overall, fantastic harness for the price.
review.name: Great First Impression

name: Solution Harness

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great little daily commuter! I‚Äôve gotten a ton of compliments on this. The only thing I wish I could change is the water bottle pouch. It is way too small to fit any of my yeti or hydro flask water bottles
review.name: Great little daily commuter! I‚Äôve

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband and I both bought panel loaders and we LOVE them! Great quality, and our 16" computers fit perfectly. They are also very comfortable to wear when bicycling or hiking.
review.name: My husband and I both

review.reviewBody: We loved our Transporter 90L wheeled duffles and the Transporter Carry On 44L for our trip to the Galapagos and 2 weeks of fun. Thinking to increase our Transporter family, I bought the Panel Loader to match the set. Unfortunately, it is just not what we wanted. The overall capacity is fine and the built in storage against the back wall of the main compartment is fine. However, the zipper on the right hand side is stopped about 1/4 way down the side and there begins the elastic water bottle compartment. Just felt that this was too awkward to access the main compartment. I didn't like the placement of the chest straps and they are attached in place with no option to move up or down. Was hoping it would work as both an airplane backpack and a hiking backpack but it just doesn't work for either option. We will purchase another Transporter Carry on 44 and then rethink the hiking options for a travel day hike option to be stored in the main duffel. If they redesign the zipper/water bottle configuration this might be better.
review.name: Love the Transporter Line but not this item

name: Transporter Panel Loader 25L Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the Recon backpack for my son for 7th grade. It lasted about 3 months, but then the strap completely tore off. Tried to get it repaired by North Face since they say they have a 1-year warranty. However, the fine print is North Face doesn't provided shipping nor do they provided return tracking numbers. Everything is based on printing a form and you may or may not get the item repaired. Bottom line is this backpack most likely won't last a year for anyone and North Face won't stand behind the product, so I don't recommend this one.
review.name: Lasted 3 months

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The vault is a great no nonsense backpack! I love the simplicity of it! It will get you from point A to Point B! It's Not a Surge or a Router! For the price point no complaints here!
review.name: Number 2 for me

review.reviewBody: This was purchased for my son's 1st year of middle school. He loved the colors and look of the bookbag, which I agree are very slick. However in practicality... it is way too small for a middle-schooler (and he's only in 6th grade) I am not sure who could practically use this backpack as it doesn't do much for carrying around notebooks, school books nor anything else. Once he's put his required school gear in the backpack there is not room for his lunchbox or jacket. We're very disappointed with this one.
review.name: Beautiful BUT small...

review.reviewBody: I got this backpack mainly for school and it has served me greatly these last few months. The water bottle pockets are very roomy and perfectly fit my wide mouth Nalgene bottle. There is plenty of room for folders/books. The only bad thing I have to say about this backpack is the laptop sleeve size. My Lenovo Legion y7000p was unfortunately too large for the sleeve.  Any other Macbook would fit just fine.
review.name: Great Backpack

name: Vault 26L Backpack
