review.reviewBody: I received an √≠tem last couple weeks ago. It fits me well and I like it a lot but it is defective after I wear the second time. I am very disappointed.
review.name: Defected after couple times wear

review.reviewBody:
I bought these because I liked my Fox defend shorts so much but wanted something lighter but with similar features.  I personally love the strap Fox uses.  It's more secure and easier to use then a button snap.  I also like the little air vents in the legs.  It makes a big difference

Sizing is a problem.
I am always a size 30 but can wear a 29 without discomfort but some tightness.  The 30's I bought are tight and feel more like 29s to me.  I only need about 3 clicks on the belt/strap for it to be tight leaving at least 15 more clicks to go.  31 would be perfect for me yet I would never consider buying a pair of 31 pants at the store.   SIZE UP!
review.name: Great shorts but ......Go up one size!

review.reviewBody: The perfect summer MTB shorts. Fox has nailed it againüëå
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I really wish people would not make recommendations about sizing, since everyone's body type is unique. I have a 32" waist and a 32 fit me perfectly. A 34" was way too big for me.
review.name: Nice product, but do not size up

review.reviewBody: I use a 28 on the previous version so I went for a 30 this time. It's fine. I'm on the slimmer side so the waist fits okay but take note the waistband doesn't stretch. The material on the shorts (not the waistband) does stretch but it's not as stretchy as the past versions. It does feel like it's more durable and more bombproof than the last one.
review.name: just size up

review.reviewBody: If you have owned the previous version of the flexair shorts (They were my favorite), know that these are MUCH shorter and MUCH smaller waist (also, they do not have a stretch waist band as the previous version). I purchased multiple of these directly from Fox and can barely get my usual size on, tight on waist, thighs and they're borderline so short they belong only with spandex, haha. So, much sure you get a size up from what you would on the previous version (at least). I don't know if that affects length, or not.
review.name: SIZE UP!

name: Flexair Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket for a hiking trip to Patagonia in November. I was very excited to try it out as I have a few down jackets but wanted to splurge and buy a nice new one for my trip, but unfortunately it did not meet my expectations. I would rate it 2.5/5. 

I also wear it on walks in the early morning in Southern California in ~50* and it does not keep me warm unless I wear a fleece under it. i have other down jackets that keep me warm without additional layers in the same weather. 

Pros:
- the jacket material is buttery and feels really nice
- the lined pockets were nice 
-lightweight and packs up very small

Cons:
- very thin, this did not keep me warm at all (wore it while hiking or hanging out at the campsite at night mid 40s - mid 50s with some mild wind at times). I had to wear either a wind breaker over it or a fleece under it. 
- already some fray along the zipper. Nothing bad but I only have worn it for 2 weeks. 
- has a boxy/ baggy fit that i don‚Äôt prefer.  I am 5‚Äô3, 115lbs and I bought a small. A fleece fit underneath comfortably but there was still a ton of room. The small was very long on me.
review.name: Would not recommend.

review.reviewBody: Great jacket! Extremely light weight and packable.

My husband bought this jacket for me, and I absolutely love how light it feels to wear! I like how it isn't overly puffy in that I look more like Hawaiian rolls and less like a swollen Michelin Man. It feels as though you are wearing a fashionably less dense goose down comforter and while it's great for wearing outdoors for walks in the crisp cool fall, it's also great to nap at home in. Added bonus with the partially lined pockets - they're perfect for me and my low circulation fingers.
review.name: LOVE the feel and fit!

name: Transcendent Down Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Just received this headlamp as a Christmas gift. Instructions make NO sense whatsoever. I have no idea how to turn this thing on, change the lighting mode, etc.

Maybe someday I can change this rating, but as of now it is just a paperweight.
review.name: Have no idea if this is any good---infographic instructions make NO NO NO sense!!!

review.reviewBody: Great little headlamp. Very lightweight and bright enough for anything.
review.name: Lightweight and bright!

review.reviewBody: Light works great for running. It has very little bounce, and it is lightweight.
review.name: Great light for a good price

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, great for trail running, backpacking trips, etc.
review.name: Great headlamp

review.reviewBody: I like the rechargeable capabilities. Very bright head lamp and isn‚Äôt too heavy.
review.name: Nice little head lamp

review.reviewBody: Over the years there has been an explosion of tech development; some things have improved life and others just complicate. The Cosmo 350-R is the perfect blend, giving you a functional rechargeable light without irrelevant bells and whistles. It works well and doesn't need disposable batteries, what more do you need?
review.name: Simple is often the best!

review.reviewBody: I really like the smooth beam from this headlamp and appreciate the rechargeable batteries as well. The 350 lumen rating is plenty of light for most conditions.
review.name: Nice smooth beam

review.reviewBody: So easy to use, rechargeable, very bright if needed but dims quickly. Used this to do field work with bats and was bright enough to check nets and can be quickly dimmed or put in red mode to minimize disturbances. Highly recommend
review.name: Best headlamp I‚Äôve owned

review.reviewBody: I have 4 black diamond headlamps. I bike ride with one. It stays with my bike for my work commute. I have one on my search and rescue helmet. I use it for hiking into the field. I also use it for repelling over the side of cliffs on car wrecks. I have one in my truck for all purpose use. And i have a backup that my daughter is currently using on dog walks. Love the red light. And love how adjustable the brightness is. All my lights are still working great. Oldest one is close to 10 years old and going strong.
review.name: Great headlamp

review.reviewBody: So much to like: great 1500 mAh battery and good light output, but stupid micro-USB charging port. Please change to USB-C and improve the drop rating to 2 meters. And as long as I‚Äôm dreaming, please improve the weather rating.
review.name: So much to like

name: Cosmo 350-R Headlamp

review.reviewBody:
Wow I was so excited when I saw the berry color, I love the contrast of the black accents. I live in the PNW and was looking for a synthetic puffy that insulates when wet that I could take hiking. 
My package got lost in the mail for about 2 weeks so I was extra excited when it showed up on my doorstep. 
I love the extra dry feel of this type of synthetic insulation, I feel like it does a great job when it‚Äôs cold and humid. The color is beautiful in person, nice pockets, seems durable. 
Anyway tried it on over a tshirt and the shoulders and upper arms were way too tight, it restricted my movement. I‚Äôm a size 14, 38DD, and I ordered an XL. There was no way I could layer at all, and the material doesn‚Äôt stretch. 
If you have a big chest or arms/shoulders proportionately I‚Äôd order a size up if that‚Äôs an option for you. It wasn‚Äôt an option for me so I returned this, but had it fit I would‚Äôve been really stoked about this jacket. 
Hey MH by the way when are you gunna make some extended sizes? I love y‚Äôall but I feel like literally every other outdoor gear company does this. It‚Äôs the 90s, get with it already :)
review.name: Runs small :(

review.reviewBody: These seem to be well made and comfortable. The horizontal seam in the back is my only complaint. It doesn't allow for as much stretch in that area. The only thing keeping them from being perfect.

review.reviewBody: Fit, quality, material, durability and comfort are very good. Dries quickly and comfortable to wear over long distance backpacking trips. Easy to wash/quick dry/rotate while hiking 10+ miles/days over several weeks. Breathable fabric, no chafing.
review.name: Good fit very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair in early 2023 for an international trip. These boxers are comfortable, easy to clean, they dry fast and last long. I bought more of this product based on my experience for my trip in late 2024.
review.name: Dries fast, great for travel

review.reviewBody: I just returned from a two week trip to France and took 4 pair of these.  They were fantastic!  First, the lightweight fabric meant they took up almost no room in my bag.  I like to travel light so that was very important to me.  But more importantly, the underwear are extremely comfortable!  I had no problems with the waistband flipping or any riding up.  We walked at least 6 miles a day and I was always comfortable and dry.  Finally, it was so easy to wash them in the sink and hang them to dry.  They‚Äôd be dry and ready to wear the next morning.  I‚Äôd buy them again in a heartbeat!
review.name: Fantastic for travel!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic fit and feel!   Soft and comfortable.  Moves with your body.
review.name: Comfort

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing these underwear for over a year. I can confidently say this is the best underwear I've ever worn. They are light, a great fit, and durable. I exercise, hike, at work in them and I've never had any fraying, breakdown, or chaffing. They're simply the best
review.name: Nothing Beats Give-N-Go

review.reviewBody: Awesome boxers and travel well! Bought several for a trip abroad and very washable/wearable.
review.name: Top Notch Boxers!

review.reviewBody: Great breathability, good fit, and color options are plenty.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody:
Probably my most favorite underwear, especially for hiking, climbing, etc.  Great fit, breathability, and they seem to stink less than other brands. 

They also last longer than other, more expensive, brands.
review.name: Best Athletic Boxer Briefs

review.reviewBody: These fit well, breathe well, and hold everything in place. I‚Äôm really glad I bought a few pairs of these. Would recommend.

description: Buy the Park Tool Pre-Glued Super Patch Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pre-Glued Super Patch Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Park Tool Pre-Glued Super Patch Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These patches work great to repair a hole in a down coat.
I am an avid cyclist as well as a mountaineer. I am tough on my gear and often rip a small hole in my down coat, and the patches will stop the feathers from flying.

I also use these patches as a short term fix to my bicycle tube. They will get you home but I would replace the tube rather than hoping the patch holds.
review.name: Not just for bicycle tubes

review.reviewBody:
These have bailed me out a couple times with minor punctures, but the last one was impressive.  I used one to cover a 1/4" cut on the tread of my rear tire, and rode home literally on it.  
I screwed up a new route and got stuck riding some singletrack on my road bike.  On 30-32 Roubaix tires, so I figured I would be ok.  I had my fun, then checked the tires after and found a cut right in the center.  The casing was fine, but I knew the cut would grow and something would eventually fail.  Without a better option I slapped one of these over the cut, on the outside of the tire.  I rode over 20 miles home on it, both paved and dirt roads.  It didn't come loose or wear through.  I was shocked.  Obviously not a permanent fix, but it got me home, and that's what I needed.  They're quick, cheap, and come in a tiny package.  Definitely worth sticking a pack in your bag.
review.name: Will get you home

review.reviewBody: I ride tubeless but always ride with an extra tube and bacon strips.  The third line of defense are these essential patches.  Plus, they are an easy way to fix the kids' tubes.  Don't play around with glue and patches, get these.
review.name: When all else fails

name: Pre-Glued Super Patch Kit

review.reviewBody: Not really sure what makes these "cargo" bibs, but I guess that's what the industry calls anything that has pockets (all bibs should have pockets imo). The leg pockets are too small to fully fit my phone (Pixel 7, not exactly a huge phone), and the back ones might(?) be able to hold your keys. I never rode with them as I realized they were way too tight on me (5'7, 170lbs, size medium) and wanted to return them so I could get the Varlo bibs. Chamois did feel way nicer than my typical Amazon special bibs, being a thicker and more firm, too bad I didn't get to use it. Leg grippers were also super grippy, like pull your leg hair off grippy, but I guess I'd rather have too grippy than not grippy enough.
review.name: "cargo" bibs

review.reviewBody:
I am 6 ft 160 lbs and have a 30 inch waist, so not exactly a linebacker. I wear a US size small Gore C5 and a medium Santini bib short. I figured a size medium would be plenty here. I can barely pull them up my legs, and to do so makes me feel like they will be ripped. I did a ride with them and my legs felt terrible, like I was losing circulation. Had to return them, might try a large, which is slightly ridiculous. 

The quality is extremely high, just wished I could wear them!
review.name: I agree with David k... Way too tight

review.reviewBody:
I have owned Assos, Rapha, Black Bibs over the years. I am 5' 10,  156lb, 32 waist.  I had not bought a pair of Pearl Izumi in a very long time.  The shorts are awesome.  I very much like the pad and the length of shorts.   I tend to like a bit of a longer length short.  The pad in particular is very comfortable.  The cut of the pad is different than Rapha or Assos.  .  No issues holding gel, iphone 13 pro or the like the pockets. 

One last comment, i tend to think of these shorts more of a long distance, multi hour ride type shorts.  These are not like Rapha pro lightweight/featherweight type shorts.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: These were my first pair of Pearl Izumi bib short, and they did not disappoint. I really like the pockets for holding snacks on rides. I've put completed several 100+ mile rides in these shorts and washed them numerous times and they've worked exceptionally well, and a few 2-3 hour rides on the trainer. I haven't had any discomfort from the pad wearing out or any signs the shorts were coming undone. I'm getting a second pair since I like them so much.
review.name: Excellent Bib shorts and great fit

review.reviewBody:
Overall materials feel great. The legs are cut very long (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô 10‚Äù and they come to an inch or so above my knee). The leg cargo pockets are not very deep at all (bars fit fine, phone or banana do not). 

My biggest complaint is the chamois, though. Not comfortable at all, mostly feels like there‚Äôs a rock solid dumpy down there. It tends to shift around a lot, too. So finding a comfortable seats is impossible. I cut a 40+ mile ride short because of how sore my poor perineum had become. 

Will stick with ASSOS from now on.
review.name: Weird chamois

review.reviewBody:
Really disappointed for the first time with Pearl Izumi. I'm 5'-8, 170 lbs, with 24" thighs. I bought a Large

I bought these bibs to try out before my wife and I head out across USA via the Southern Tier next year. I love my PI Pro Bibs and with the drop seat feature I thought these would be perfect.... WRONG!

Compared to the Pro Bibs the legs are significantly more narrow and are tight around my calves, let alone my thighs.  Once up, they felt like tourniquets on my thighs. It was such a relief to take them off after a simple 35 mile ride. I've tried to uploaded comparison photos of the bibs around my calves.

The drop seat is basically a pain in the ass! It doesn't work as you stretch the bibs tight down below to sit. Then your so busy keeping the bibs stretched that can't do the paperwork. 

At $265 look for something else unless your thighs are 15".
review.name: Back to the drawing board!

name: Expedition Pro Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: They shipped me a cassette that was cleared assembled in another bike before. The part was all dirty with grease and the lock ring was for Ultegra not 105. They just put the parts together and locked with zip tie. Unfortunately, I was on the USA for vacation and I didn‚Äôt have enough time to return the item and get my refund. After contacting them and explaining everything they just offered me a partial refund of 10 dollars, which I had to accept since I was not able to return the item for full refund. It was a really bad experience to buy something new and receive a product in this condition.
review.name: Received part in bad condition

review.reviewBody: I have had several versions of the cassette (11-28T and 11-32T) that have delivered for me. I used my 11-28T for the trainer and 11-32T on the road. Both have worked well. You need to keep your drivetrain clean and you won't have any issues. I don't really mind the extra weight when compared to Ultegra.
review.name: Reliable, as usual

review.reviewBody:
One of the heaviest of the top tier level Shimano cassettes, but these do the job well like their counterpart (Ultegra and Dura Ace).

Picking out your gear ratios are a personal thing. For me, I got the 11-30t (weighing around ~285g) and running a standard 53/39 crank. I'm able to push up 8-11% gradient hills without burning out (still a suffer effort) and speed through flats.

I'm pretty happy with this gear ratio so far and weight on these aren't a big issue.
review.name: Durable, Sturdy, Dependable

name: 105 CS-R7000 Cassette

description: Buy the The North Face Base Camp XL 132L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Base Camp XL 132L Duffel Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Base Camp XL 132L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The bag is great! It is mostly water proof and has plenty of space. The zippers are a little clunky and stick sometimes. Over all an amazing purchase.
review.name: I would absolutely buy this bag again

review.reviewBody: Great bag and high quality. Worked great for my job (wildland fire fighter). Rugged enough for the job but flexible enough to stuff all my gear in without things getting stuck or hung up when I put it in. I can fit 14 days of clothes, a tent, pad, sleeping bag and my shower bag with room to spare. All around great bag.
review.name: All around great bag!

review.reviewBody: the back of our trunk got flooded 3" deep with water when a seal on the trunk let a bunch of unpredicted rainstorm water. everything in regular bags soaked. nothing inside the duffel got wet.
review.name: this is the best duffel! saved our clothes!

review.reviewBody: This bag is awesome. My dad and brother both have one, so I decided it was time I got one for myself. We use it for all kinds of things, so durability is its best quality.
review.name: Cannot recommend enough!!!

review.reviewBody: Honestly the best quality and space a traveling duffel bag could have. I had a medium sized duffel bag that I still use today and would travel planes, trains and automobiles and it holds up for every single trip. Highly suggest this duffel and hard to find a better quality bag.
review.name: Duffel yeah!

review.reviewBody: This bag is exactly what we wanted, it replaced a previous NorthFace bag that we used for over 10 years I travels world wide. Highly recommend, very sturdy
review.name: The Best!

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for an international flight and plan to use it for many upcoming trips. Great construction and I am glad I bought the XL- the XXL might be the move if you need even more space but the XL is BIG!!
review.name: Great bag- would definitely recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice bag. Had one back in the day that was warranty replaced with this. Hope to give it many years of good use.
review.name: the OG duffel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ultimately returned this bag in exchange for the medium version. The medium is still very spacious for what I intend to use my bag for. I started boxing and needed a bag to hold two pairs of sneakers, boxing gloves, and other potential gear I may need to carry. This XL version is enormous and would be great for a potential weeklong trip somewhere. The quality is amazing but be sure to pick the right size for what you need it for.
review.name: Extremely Spacious Bag

review.reviewBody: The fabric is very heavy duty, but I am flabbergasted that the backpack straps and carrying straps are not removable via quick connect or able to tuck inside the bag. This is a major design omission that is available on most gear bags.
review.name: North Face Base Camp XL

name: Base Camp XL 132L Duffel Bag
